qas.question: Who is the only one who has the authority to stop the game when something is wron?
Besides a referee interfering, when else is play stopped?

answers.text: when the ball has left the field of play

qas.question: Who is not allowed to guard the goal?
Who is the only one who does not have the authority to stop the game when something is wrong?
What is not allowed but restricted?

plausible_answers.text: when the ball has left the field of play

qas.question: When is play not allowed to be stopped?

plausible_answers.text: play recommences with a specified restart

context: In game play, players attempt to create goal-scoring opportunities through individual control of the ball, such as by dribbling, passing the ball to a team-mate, and by taking shots at the goal, which is guarded by the opposing <a0_0><b4_0>goalkeeper<b4_0/><a0_0/>. Opposing players may try to regain control of the ball by intercepting a pass or through tackling the opponent in possession of the ball; however, <a2_0><b6_0>physical contact<b6_0/><a2_0/> between opponents is restricted. Football is generally a free-flowing game, with play stopping only <a3_0><b7_0>when the ball has left the field of play<b7_0/><a3_0/> or when play is stopped by the <a1_0><b5_0>referee<b5_0/><a1_0/> for an infringement of the rules. After a stoppage, <b8_0>play recommences with a specified restart<b8_0/>.
